snippet: Pakistan’s political leaders have reacted with unusual vehemence since missiles fired by American drones killed the leader of the Pakistani Taliban, Hakimullah Mehsud, on Friday.
abstract: News analysis; Pakistan's political leaders have reacted with unusual vehemence to drone strike that killed Hakimullah Mehsud, leader of Pakistani Taliban, who was Public Enemy No 1 in the country; some American security analysts see the furious reaction as another sign of the perversity and ingratitude that they say have scarred Pakistan's relationship with the United States.
lead_paragraph: Pakistan’s political leaders have reacted with unusual vehemence since missiles fired by American drones killed the leader of the Pakistani Taliban, Hakimullah Mehsud, on Friday.

headline.main: In Pakistan, Drone Strike Turns a Villain Into a Victim
headline.print_headline: Death by Drone Turns a Villain Into a Martyr
